_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four kinds of mindfulness meditation: Meditate observing an aspect of the body internally
Meditate observing an aspect of the body externally
Meditate observing an aspect of the body internally and externally
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings externally
Meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally and externally
Meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally
Meditate observing an aspect of the mind externally
Meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally and externally
Meditate observing an aspect of principles internally
Meditate observing an aspect of principles externally
Meditate observing an aspect of principles internally and externally
The qualities to be developed (a causal: Being rid of desire and aversion for the world
The result of developing the four kinds: Whether by day or by night
